papers.title: Laser Stark Spectroscopy of AsH3 Using 9.4 and 10.6 μm CO2 Laser
papers.venue: Bulletin of the Chemical Society of Japan
papers.abstract:
<jats:title>Abstract</jats:title>
               <jats:p>Perturbation-allowed transitions of the v2 and v4 bands of AsH3 were observed. About 100 Stark components were assigned to six Δ(k-l)=0, six Δ(k-l)=±3, and three Δ(k-l)=±6 transitions. The Stark patterns and hyperfine splittings were used for confirming the assignment.</jats:p>

llm_analysis.reasoning: The title explicitly mentions 'AsH3' and 'Laser Stark Spectroscopy,' which is a high-resolution experimental technique known to provide assigned transitions with precise frequencies and uncertainties, perfectly matching the MARVEL algorithm input requirements.
